skills.label: Reading Errors
skills.description: I ALWAYS READ THE ERROR STACK TRACE

skills.label: Identify Error Location
skills.description: I identify the file and linenumber of the error from the stack trace

skills.label: Use of p
skills.description: I use p to print variable states to understand code

skills.label: Use irb
skills.description: I use irb to test review and understand code

skills.label: Clear Tests
skills.description: Build test methods with descriptive output and clear indicators of passing tests

skills.label: Fork and clone
skills.description: I know how to git fork and clone

skills.label: Remotes
skills.description: I know how to check which remotes are configured for my repository

skills.label: loop n times
skills.description: I know how to loop n times

skills.label: #each vs #map
skills.description: I know the difference between #each and #map

skills.label: symbols
skills.description: I know what a :symbol is

skills.label: Ruby Branching
skills.description: I know the difference between else and elsif

skills.label: Return values
skills.description: I can identify possible return values in code samples in challenges

skills.label: Recursion vs Iteration
skills.description: I can identify recursive and iterative code

skills.label: case and when
skills.description: I can read and understand case and when structure

skills.label: Regular Expresssionsss
skills.description: I use regular expressions

skills.label: Enumerable
skills.description: I have researched the Enumerable module

skills.label: Hash vs Array
skills.description: I know when to use a Hash instead of an Array

skills.label: Nested Arrays
skills.description: I understand how to access nested array data

skills.label: Linked List
skills.description: I have implemented a Linked List data structure in Ruby

skills.label: Stack
skills.description: I have Implemented a Stack data structure in Ruby

skills.label: POODR
skills.description: I have read all of Practical Object Oriented Design in Ruby

skills.label: Single Responsibility Principle
skills.description: I write methods that each have a single responsibility

skills.label: initialize
skills.description: I how initialize is used

skills.label: class
skills.description: I how class is used define a new class

skills.label: module
skills.description: I how module is used to encapsulate behavior

skills.label: Refactor with Inheritance
skills.description: I know how to move code into a super class

skills.label: Refactor with Module
skills.description: I know how to move code into a module and include into a class

skills.label: Method Lookup
skills.description: I understand how method lookup works with inheritance

skills.label: Primary Key
skills.description: I can describe how primary keys are used

skills.label: Foreign Key
skills.description: I can describe how foreign keys are used

skills.label: Table vs Database
skills.description: I can describe difference between a table and a database

skills.label: CREATE TABLE
skills.description: I know how to write a CREATE TABLE statement

skills.label: SELECT columns
skills.description: I know how to write a SELECT statement which specifies which columns to return

skills.label: UPDATE
skills.description: I know how to write an UPDATE statement which updates a single row

skills.label: INSERT
skills.description: I know how to write an INSERT statement which adds a new row

skills.label: WHERE
skills.description: I know how to use WHERE to specify which rows are affected

skills.label: INNER vs OUTER JOIN
skills.description: I can explain the difference between an INNER and an OUTER JOIN
